document.docAuthor: Lü, Zhaozhi, Zhao, Ping & Cai, Wanzhi
document.docTitle: Hsiaotycoris tuberculatus Lu, Zhao & Cai, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Hsiaotycoris tuberculatus, a new genus and species of Harpactorinae (Heteroptera: Reduviidae) from China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Hsiaotycoris tuberculatus, a new genus and species of Harpactorinae (Heteroptera: Reduviidae) from China

heading.emphasis:
Hsiaotycoris tuberculatus Lü, Zhao & Cai
, sp. nov. (
Figs. 1–29
)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material.
Holotype , Ψ; China , Yunnan, Mengla, Wangtianshu;
3 .V. 2005
; X. S. Bai leg. Paratypes ,
1 ♂
; China , Yunnan, Jingdong, Xujiaba;
30 .IV. 2005
; H. S. Wang leg.

1 Ψ; same data as holotype ; left III–IV antennal segments missing.
1 ♂
, 1 Ψ; same collecting place as for holotype ;
6 .VI. 2005
; J. X. Cui leg.
Etymology. The specific name refers to the fact some parts of the body surface bear many tuberculate processes.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–4.
Hsiaotycoris tuberculatus Lü, Zhao & Cai
,
sp. nov.
,. 1, Habitus; 2–4, first to third antennal segments, showing setiferous tubercles; 1, dorsal view; 2–4, lateral view. Scale bar of 1 = 1.67 mm; of 2–4 = 0.50 mm.

FIGURES 5–8.
Hsiaotycoris tuberculatus
Lü, Zhao & Cai
,
sp. nov .
, ♂. 5, Habitus; 6–8, first to third antennal segments, showing setiferous tubercles; 5, dorsal view; 6–8, lateral view. Scale bar of 5 = 1.54 mm; of 6–8 = 0.50 mm.

FIGURES 9–16.
Hsiaotycoris tuberculatus
Lü
, Zhao
& Cai
,
sp. nov.
, 9–15,; 16, ♂. 9–11, 16, Apical part of abdomen; 12, head and pronotum, antennae removed; 13–15, fore, mid and hind legs; 9, 16, ventral view; 10, 12–15 lateral view; 11, caudal view. Scale bar of 9, 10, 12–16 = 2.00 mm, of 11 = 1.00 mm.

FIGURES 17–29.
Hsiaotycoris tuberculatus
Lü, Zhao
& Cai
,
sp. nov.
, ♂. 17, Head and pronotum, antennae removed; 18, apical part of abdomen; 19–21, fore, mid, and hind legs; 22, pygophore; 23, phallus; 24, 25, phallosoma; 26–29, paramere. 17–23, lateral view; 24, dorsal view; 25, ventral

subSubSection.paragraph: view. Scale bar of 17–21 = 1.00 mm; of 22–29 = 0.25 mm .
